security: This document is marked TOP SECRET, indicating that unauthorized disclosure could cause exceptionally grave damage to national security. Sharing the details of this hearing could reveal sensitive intelligence activities and compromise sources and methods.
summary: This document is a transcript of a Senate Select Committee hearing held on July 10, 1975, regarding governmental operations with respect to intelligence activities. Richard Goodwin provides testimony during the session.
summary_one_paragraph: This is a transcript from a hearing held before the Senate Select Committee to Study Governmental Operations with Respect to Intelligence Activities on July 10, 1975, in Washington, D.C. The hearing, presided over by Senator Frank Church, includes testimony from Richard M. Goodwin, and discussion among committee members Senators Hart of Michigan, Mondale, Huddleston, Hart of Colorado, Tower, Baker, and Schweiker. Staff members such as William Miller, Frederick A. O. Schwarz, Jr., and others are also present, and the proceedings are recorded by Ward & Paul, a Washington, D.C. reporting firm.
title: SSCIA Hearing on Governmental Operations with Respect to Intelligence Activities
